Faisal,

My source code for rtNEAT is available for research use now.  You =

can download it from:

http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/keyword?rtneat

It comes wi=
th an example real-time loop.

What is still not available is NERO source. =
 However, while it is 
taking a long time, there is still a plan to create =
an open-source 
version of NERO.  We are now trying to extract Torque from =
NERO and 
replace it with a public domain engine.

I think your domain coul=
d be interesting but I don't know enough 
details about the tools and obsta=
cles to add a lot of comment.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Faisal Ab=
idi" <fabidi@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
> 
> I'm a Computer Science (Bachelors) sen=
ior, a student researcher 
for the
> Microsoft Innovation Centre at FAST-NU=
, Pakistan. I plan to extend 
SharpNEAT
> to include Swarm behavior for my =
final year project (NEATswarm).
> 
> My first application idea was to demon=
strate NEATswarm in self-
organizing
> p2p grids, but I decided to choose a=
nother app to reduce the scope 
of my
> project.
> 
> I came up with Autono=
mous Lemmings. In AL, the population 
(individuals
> tentatively represente=
d as spheres) lives in a world in which 
every object
> can be seen as eith=
er an obstacle or a tool. They're goal is to 
reach some
> arbitrary rally =
point. The individuals must work together to 
negotiate
> obstacles in a ma=
nner a bit like the classic Lemmings game, but 
without
> human interaction=
 (and in a 3d world). I still have to work out a 
way to
> contrast it with=
 the the performance of uncoordinated behavior. 
Under my
> current vision =
of AL, without coordination the pop may simply fail 
to ever
> reach the ra=
lly point (I imagine they won't be be willing to stand 
on each
> other's h=
eads so some can reach higher ground). The world will be 
dynamic
> (unexpe=
cted crumbling,  Suggestions?
> 
> So there's the same real-time aspect tha=
t's in the nero game.
> Ken posted back in 2005 : "someone who registered f=
or Torque 
(which is
> cheap) could then download NERO and rtNEAT and obtai=
n a research-
only
> license"
> I found no news that this event has happene=
d yet, so is there some
> alternative to rtNEAT that I could use?
> 
> If a=
nyone could suggest a variation on the "obstacle-negotiation 
theme",
> tha=
t'd be really cool. I have a team of 4 including myself. No 
entire
> depar=
tments collaborating here:).
> I found a post where Mridul mentioned doing =
an MS thesis on Swarm
> Intelligence for NEAT. Interesting stuff in the con=
versation. Any 
pointers
> would be greatly appreciated. And any comments a=
bout the very 
foundation of
> my idea.

> Faisal Abidi
